snippet: Some analysts see the protests as less about Muslim intolerance than about extremists’ exploiting popular anger to draw attention to political goals.
abstract: Some analysts see the protests and Arab uprisings as less about Muslim intolerance than about the ideological chaos that reigns in the Arab world, where extremists routinely exploit popular anger and invoke Islam to draw attention to their goals; Libya and Egypt are especially vulnerable as their new national governments are still insecure about the exercise of authority.
lead_paragraph: Some analysts see the protests as less about Muslim intolerance than about extremists’ exploiting popular anger to draw attention to political goals.

headline.seo: Ideological Struggle Seen in Middle East Attacks
headline.main: Struggle for Ideological Upper Hand in Muslim World Seen as Factor in Attacks
headline.print_headline: Struggle for Ideological Upper Hand in Muslim World Seen as Factor in Attacks
